snippet: Now that painful budget cuts are imminent, corporate executives seem to have realized that federal spending is important to the economy after all.
abstract: Editorial notes that corporate executives are finally realizing the massive spending cuts set to take effect in 2013 will cause a severe contraction of the economy; suggests best approach would be to delay the spending cuts while extending the Bush-era tax cuts only for those making up to $250,000 per year.
lead_paragraph: Now that painful budget cuts are imminent, corporate executives seem to have realized that federal spending is important to the economy after all.
